title: Joe Wright (rugby league)
text:
Joseph Wright (28 June 1908 – 1967) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a>, and as a , or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
International honours.
Joe Wright won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Swinton in 1932 against Wales, in 1933 against <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>, and in 1934 against France, and won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Swinton in 1932 against New Zealand.
